sentence.value: Having completed the initial two years of intensive Space Shuttle and Space Station training, he was assigned technical duties in the Space Station Branch of the Astronaut Office, where his primary focus involved the command and control computers on Space Station, as well as the office automation support computers, and the operational Local Area Network encompassing all international partners and modules.
sentence.pattern_crowdsource: null

sentence.value: Beginning November 2000, Creamer became the Crew Support Astronaut for the Expedition 3 crew, which was on orbit from August 2001 to December 2001.
sentence.annotated-sentence: Beginning [[November 2000|November_2000]], [[Creamer|Results_May_Vary]] became the Crew Support [[Astronaut|Astronaut]] for the [[Expedition 3|Expedition_3]] crew, which was on orbit from [[August 2001|August_2001]] to [[December 2001|December_2001]].
sentence.pattern_crowdsource: Beginning November 2000, Creamer became the Crew Support [[Astronaut|Astronaut]] for the Expedition 3 crew, which was on orbit from August 2001 to December 2001.

sentence.value: Starting March 2002, Creamer headed the Hardware Integration Section of the Space Station Branch, responsible for ensuring all hardware configurations were properly integrated, and that all operational aspects of the future International Space Station (ISS) hardware are accounted for.

sentence.value: In September 2006, Creamer served as an aquanaut during the NEEMO 11 mission aboard the Aquarius underwater laboratory, living and working underwater for seven days.
sentence.annotated-sentence: In [[September 2006|September_2006]], [[Creamer|Results_May_Vary]] served as [[an aquanaut|Aquanaut]] during the [[NEEMO|NEEMO]] 11 mission aboard [[the Aquarius underwater laboratory|Aquarius_(laboratory)]], living and working underwater for seven days.
